articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The warrants are for alleged war crimes and crimes against humanity.
articles.title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Israel's Netanyahu, Gallant and Hamas leader

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: It's the first time Russia has used such a powerful, long-range missile during the war.
articles.title: Russia launches intercontinental ballistic missile in attack on Ukraine, Kyiv says

articles.author: Laila Bassam
articles.description: Lebanese officials requested the changes during meetings in Beirut with U.S. mediator Amos Hochstein.
articles.title: Exclusive: Lebanon seeks faster Israeli pull-out, right to self-defence in truce, official says

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Tom Perry
articles.description: Airstrikes pounded Beirut's southern suburbs and rockets flew into northern Israel.
articles.title: Israel, Hezbollah trade deadly blows despite ceasefire talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: John Prescott, a former British deputy prime minister in Tony Blair's Labour government, has died, his family said on Thursday.
articles.title: Former UK deputy PM Prescott dies, his family says

articles.author: Hatem Khaled
articles.description: As Areej al-Qadi tearfully kissed the bodies of her three young children killed by an Israeli air strike in Gaza, another mourner lashed out at the United States and Arab leaders for not ending the war.
articles.title: At Gaza funeral, lost dreams and condemnation of U.S. and Arab states

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States rejected a decision by the International Criminal Court (ICC) to issue arrest warrants on Thursday for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his former defense chief, a White House National Security Council spokesperson said.
articles.title: US rejects ICC arrest warrants for Israeli officials, White House spokesperson says

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: FBI Director Christopher Wray and Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas on Thursday declined to appear publicly before a U.S. Senate committee to discuss national security threats, provoking the ire of the panel's Democratic chairman.
articles.title: FBI, DHS leaders decline to testify publicly about threats facing US

articles.author: Angelo Amante
articles.description: Italy's right-wing coalition has passed rules to change the courts responsible for validating the detention of migrants, in what the opposition said was a vendetta against judges who recently blocked a plan to send asylum seekers to Albania.
articles.title: Italy moves to replace courts that ruled against its migrant detentions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazilian federal police have concluded that former president Jair Bolsonaro had "full knowledge" of a plot to kill then president-elect Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in 2022 before he took office, CNN Brasil reported on Thursday, citing police sources.
articles.title: Bolsonaro knew of plot to kill Lula, Brazil police find, CNN Brasil says
